ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Statistics and how to implement them in R + how to interpret stats
R data analysis language, different types of statistical experiments and concepts, data analysis skills, data sorting and cleaning
I learned some important functions in R and how to build regression models in R.
Developed lots of skills in R in terms of data analysis

This course is phenomenal, one of the best I've taken at Yale. It is very hands on and you learn practical skills. It also doesn't neglect the probability and more theoretical side of the subject area.
Statistical inference and the ability to code in r
I learned how to interpret and analyze data using r markdown. The methods used taught me a lot about trends and how to interpret them and apply it to the broader world.
Coding in R, statistical reasoning and data analysis
coding, problem solving, data analysis and exploration, data visuals

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I felt disappointed by the lack of promptness on the part of the TAs in answering student questions on Ed Discussion. Many times it would take two or more days to get a question answered about homework, and I personally asked a question about an assignment that wasn't answered until an hour or two before the deadline.

Strengths: this is one of the best-structured courses I've taken. The video lessons being uploaded on the site were so helpful because I could go back and watch them until I understood the content. This, paired with the office hours that I could go to if I had questions, was very effective in allowing me to learn.

Improvements: It would be great if there were more office hours (just so that I have a chance to ask all my questions, which I sometimes can't do if there are too many people in the office hour).

Strengths: JDRS does a great job with his video lectures, the course is asynchronous, abundance of office hours - plenty of opportunities to receive help. Weaknesses: TFs make many mistakes when grading the homeworks, TFs don't always respond soon enough to questions on Ed, I wish JDRS was more clear on what the final grading will look like in this class, grade cutoffs for final letter grades appear to be quite high because students tend to perform very well on all of the assignments, grading is very meticulous, TFs will take off many points for minor mistakes made on the homework assignments that can easily impact your grade
I thought the structure of the course was very good, it was very easy to follow along and learn. The pace was good too.
It is very well tailored and thought out, there isn't much that could be done better.
JDRS is amazing! The material is interesting, and I liked the psets. One downside is that the curve can be a bit harsh (many people receive 100s on psets).
Strength was the professor and the TAs, always available to answer questions and help out. Weakness was all the homeworks.
The course video lectures were very engaging and led into the homeworks well. Maybe providing answer keys to the homework after they are graded to clearly show what students missed.

The course is very well organized and easy to follow along with the psets/lectures. Sometimes, I felt like I was losing points for silly mistakes on homework and exams, so I wish I had a clearer guide for what exactly is expected on homework problems where we are told to explain/analyze the results.

strengths: material was well-explained, psets and tests matched the content of lectures
weaknesses: got really hard really fast

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it's a good way to get a QR credit, especially for those who aren't great with doing actual calculations themselves. The asynchronous format is really conducive to self-pacing and being able to take the class alongside other responsibilities.
Yes, it's very helpful to understand stats and intro level R.
Yes, is sets the stage for many higher level statistics and data science classes. R is a very useful language to learn.
Yes, I would recommend it if they are interested in learning data science and they want to get an introduction in R.
Yes absolutely, it is the perfect amount of work and as long as you stay consistent you will learn a lot and not be unnecessarily stressed.
Yes I would
Yes I would! The professor is very good and the work is almost fun as I enjoy looking at and analyzing data.

If you are interested in stats and think that the coding skills would be useful, definitely take it (I took the course to prepare for my thesis). Just be very prepared for the summer course to move very quickly with no breaks in the workload.
I would recommend this course to another student

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I'm a Political Science major, so I will definitely utilize these skills in political surveys and analyzing information.
I hope to apply my R, data science, and statistical reasoning skills to research endeavors, natural science lab classes, and personal projects I pursue in the future.
I will use it as a foundation for harder statistics courses.
I am very excited to apply the learnings in the world of statistics.
I will use them to further advance my statistical knowledge, and apply them to other aspects of my life
I will now be able to look at and evaluate data in order to analyze trends.

As a Political Science major, this course gave me great knowledge that I can use for my thesis and other future political science research. Also, the coding skills will definitely be helpful for my postgrad work.
The content will be useful in furthering my studies in data science as I obtain the certificate
